info.title: Nimiq JSON-RPC Specification
info.description: Through the use of JSON-RPC, Nimiq nodes expose a set of standardized methods and endpoints that allow external applications and tools to interact, stream and control the behavior of the nodes. This includes functionalities such as retrieving information about the blockchain state, submitting transactions, managing accounts, and configuring node settings.

methods.name: createAccount
methods.description: Generates a new account and store it.

methods.name: createBasicTransaction
methods.description: Returns a serialized basic transaction.

methods.name: createBasicTransactionWithData
methods.description: Returns a serialized basic transaction with an arbitrary data field.

methods.name: createDeactivateValidatorTransaction
methods.description: Returns a serialized `deactivate_validator` transaction. You need to provide the address of a basic account (the sender wallet) to pay the transaction fee.

methods.name: createDeleteValidatorTransaction
methods.description: Returns a serialized `delete_validator` transaction. The transaction fee will be paid from the validator deposit that is being returned. Note in order for this transaction to be accepted fee + value should be equal to the validator deposit, which is not a fixed value: Failed delete validator transactions can diminish the validator deposit

methods.name: createNewHtlcTransaction
methods.description: Returns a serialized transaction creating a new HTLC contract.

methods.name: createNewStakerTransaction
methods.description: Returns a serialized `new_staker` transaction. You need to provide the address of a basic account (the sender wallet) to pay the transaction fee.

methods.name: createNewValidatorTransaction
methods.description: Returns a serialized `new_validator` transaction. You need to provide the address of a basic account (the sender wallet) to pay the transaction fee and the validator deposit. Since JSON doesn't have a primitive for Option (it just has the null primitive), we can't have a double Option. So we use the following work-around for the signal data: \"\" = Set the signal data field to None. \"0x29a4b...\" = Set the signal data field to Some(0x29a4b...).

methods.name: createNewVestingTransaction
methods.description: Returns a serialized transaction creating a new vesting contract.

methods.name: createReactivateValidatorTransaction
methods.description: Returns a serialized `reactivate_validator` transaction. You need to provide the address of a basic account (the sender wallet) to pay the transaction fee.

methods.name: createRedeemEarlyHtlcTransaction
methods.description: Returns a serialized transaction redeeming a HTLC contract using the `EarlyResolve` method.

methods.name: createRedeemRegularHtlcTransaction
methods.description: Returns a serialized transaction redeeming a HTLC contract using the `RegularTransfer` method.

methods.name: createRedeemTimeoutHtlcTransaction
methods.description: Returns a serialized transaction redeeming a HTLC contract using the `TimeoutResolve` method.

methods.name: createRedeemVestingTransaction
methods.description: Returns a serialized transaction redeeming a vesting contract.

methods.name: createRemoveStakeTransaction
methods.description: Returns a serialized `remove_stake` transaction. The transaction fee will be paid from the funds being removed.

methods.name: createRetireStakeTransaction
methods.description: Returns a serialized `retire_stake` transaction. You can pay the transaction fee from a basic account (by providing the sender wallet) or from the staker account's balance (by not providing a sender wallet).

methods.name: createRetireValidatorTransaction
methods.description: Returns a serialized `retire_validator` transaction. You need to provide the address of a basic account (the sender wallet) to pay the transaction fee.

methods.name: createSetActiveStakeTransaction
methods.description: Returns a serialized `set_active_stake` transaction. You can pay the transaction fee from a basic account (by providing the sender wallet) or from the staker account's balance (by not providing a sender wallet).

methods.name: createStakeTransaction
methods.description: Returns a serialized `stake` transaction. The funds to be staked and the transaction fee will be paid from the `sender_wallet`.

methods.name: createUpdateStakerTransaction
methods.description: Returns a serialized `update_staker` transaction. You can pay the transaction fee from a basic account (by providing the sender wallet) or from the staker account's balance (by not providing a sender wallet).

methods.name: createUpdateValidatorTransaction
methods.description: Returns a serialized `update_validator` transaction. You need to provide the address of a basic account (the sender wallet) to pay the transaction fee. Since JSON doesn't have a primitive for Option (it just has the null primitive), we can't have a double Option. So we use the following work-around for the signal data: null = No change in the signal data field. \"\" = Change the signal data field to None. \"0x29a4b...\" = Change the signal data field to Some(0x29a4b...).

methods.name: getAccountByAddress
methods.description: Tries to fetch the account at the given address.

methods.name: getAccounts
methods.description: Fetches all accounts in the accounts tree. IMPORTANT: This operation iterates over all accounts in the accounts tree and thus is extremely computationally expensive.

methods.name: getActiveValidators
methods.description: Returns a collection of the currently active validator's addresses and balances.

methods.name: getAddress
methods.description: Returns our validator address.

methods.name: getBatchAt
methods.description: Returns the batch number at a given `block_number` (height).

methods.name: getBatchIndexAt
methods.description: Returns the batch index at a given block number. The batch index is the number of a block relative to the batch it is in. For example, the first block of any batch always has an batch index of 0.

methods.name: getBatchNumber
methods.description: Returns the batch number for the current head.

methods.name: getBlockAfterJail
methods.description: Returns the first block after the jail period of a given block number has ended.

methods.name: getBlockAfterReportingWindow
methods.description: Returns the first block after the reporting window of a given block number has ended.

methods.name: getBlockByHash
methods.description: Tries to fetch a block given its hash. It has an option to include the transactions in the block, which defaults to false.

methods.name: getBlockByNumber
methods.description: Tries to fetch a block given its number. It has an option to include the transactions in the block, which defaults to false. Note that this function will only fetch blocks that are part of the main chain.

methods.name: getBlockNumber
methods.description: Returns the block number for the current head.

methods.name: getCurrentPenalizedSlots
methods.description: Returns information about the currently penalized slots. This includes slots that lost rewards and that were disabled.

methods.name: getElectionBlockAfter
methods.description: Returns the number (height) of the next election macro block after a given block number (height).

methods.name: getElectionBlockBefore
methods.description: Returns the number block (height) of the preceding election macro block before a given block number (height). If the given block number is an election macro block, it returns the election macro block before it.

methods.name: getElectionBlockOf
methods.description: Returns the block number of the election macro block of the given epoch (which is always the last block).

methods.name: getEpochAt
methods.description: Returns the epoch number at a given block number (height).

methods.name: getEpochIndexAt
methods.description: Returns the epoch index at a given block number. The epoch index is the number of a block relative to the epoch it is in. For example, the first block of any epoch always has an epoch index of 0.

methods.name: getEpochNumber
methods.description: Returns the epoch number for the current head.

methods.name: getFirstBatchOfEpoch
methods.description: Returns a boolean expressing if the batch at a given block number (height) is the first batch of the epoch.

methods.name: getFirstBlockOf
methods.description: Returns the block number of the first block of the given epoch (which is always a micro block).

methods.name: getFirstBlockOfBatch
methods.description: Returns the block number of the first block of the given batch (which is always a micro block).

methods.name: getInherentsByBatchNumber
methods.description: Returns all the inherents (including reward inherents) for the given batch number. Note that this only considers blocks in the main chain.

methods.name: getInherentsByBlockNumber
methods.description: Returns all the inherents (including reward inherents) for the given block number. Note that this only considers blocks in the main chain.

methods.name: getLastElectionBlock
methods.description: Returns the block number (height) of the last election macro block at a given block number (height). If the given block number is an election macro block, then it returns that block number.

methods.name: getLastMacroBlock
methods.description: Returns block the number (height) of the last macro block at a given block number (height). If the given block number is a macro block, then it returns that block number.

methods.name: getLatestBlock
methods.description: Returns the block at the head of the main chain. It has an option to include the transactions in the block, which defaults to false.

methods.name: getMacroBlockAfter
methods.description: Returns the block number (height) of the next macro block after a given block number (height).

methods.name: getMacroBlockBefore
methods.description: Returns the block number (height) of the preceding macro block before a given block number (height). If the given block number is a macro block, it returns the macro block before it.

methods.name: getMacroBlockOf
methods.description: Returns the block number of the macro block (checkpoint or election) of the given batch (which is always the last block).

methods.name: getMinFeePerByte
methods.description: Obtains the minimum fee per byte as per mempool configuration.

methods.name: getPeerCount
methods.description: Returns the number of peers.

methods.name: getPeerId
methods.description: Returns the peer ID for our local peer.

methods.name: getPeerList
methods.description: Returns a list with the IDs of all our peers.

methods.name: getPolicyConstants
methods.description: Returns a bundle of policy constants.

methods.name: getPreviousPenalizedSlots
methods.description: Returns information about the penalized slots of the previous batch. This includes slots that lost rewards and that were disabled.

methods.name: getRawTransactionInfo
methods.description: Given a serialized transaction, it will return the corresponding transaction struct.

methods.name: getSigningKey
methods.description: Returns our validator signing key.

methods.name: getSlotAt
methods.description: Returns information about the proposer slot at the given block height and offset. The offset is optional, it will default to getting the offset for the existing block at the given height. We only have this information available for the last 2 batches at most.

methods.name: getStakerByAddress
methods.description: Tries to fetch a staker information given its address.

methods.name: getStakersByValidatorAddress
methods.description: Fetches all stakers for a given validator. IMPORTANT: This operation iterates over all stakers of the staking contract and thus is extremely computationally expensive.

methods.name: getSupplyAt
methods.description: Returns the supply at a given time (as Unix time) in Lunas (1 NIM = 100,000 Lunas). It is calculated using the following formula: ```text supply(t) = total_supply - (total_supply - genesis_supply) * supply_decay^t ``` Where t is the time in milliseconds since the PoS genesis block and `genesis_supply` is the supply at the genesis of the Nimiq 2.0 chain.

methods.name: getTransactionByHash
methods.description: Tries to fetch a transaction (including reward transactions) given its hash.

methods.name: getTransactionFromMempool
methods.description: Tries to obtain the given transaction (using its hash) from the mempool.

methods.name: getTransactionHashesByAddress
methods.description: Returns the hashes for the latest transactions for a given address. All the transactions where the given address is listed as a recipient or as a sender are considered. Reward transactions are also returned. It has an option to specify the maximum number of hashes to fetch, it defaults to 500. It has also an option to retrieve transactions before a given transaction hash (exclusive). If this hash is not found or does not belong to this address, it will return an empty list. The transaction hashes are returned in descending order, meaning the latest transaction is the first.

methods.name: getTransactionsByAddress
methods.description: Returns the latest transactions for a given address. All the transactions where the given address is listed as a recipient or as a sender are considered. Reward transactions are also returned. It has an option to specify the maximum number of transactions to fetch, it defaults to 500. It has also an option to retrieve transactions before a given transaction hash (exclusive). If this hash is not found or does not belong to this address, it will return an empty list. The transactions are returned in descending order, meaning the latest transaction is the first.

methods.name: getTransactionsByBatchNumber
methods.description: Returns all the transactions (including reward transactions) for the given batch number. Note that this only considers blocks in the main chain.

methods.name: getTransactionsByBlockNumber
methods.description: Returns all the transactions (including reward transactions) for the given block number. Note that this only considers blocks in the main chain.

methods.name: getValidatorByAddress
methods.description: Tries to fetch a validator information given its address.

methods.name: getValidators
methods.description: Fetches all validators in the staking contract. IMPORTANT: This operation iterates over all validators in the staking contract and thus is extremely computationally expensive.

methods.name: getVotingKey
methods.description: Returns our current validator voting key.

methods.name: getVotingKeys
methods.description: Returns all available voting keys.

methods.name: getZkpState
methods.description: Returns the current ZKP state (proof with its related block hash and block number).

methods.name: importRawKey
methods.description: Import an account by its private key, in hexadecimal format, and lock it with the passphrase.

methods.name: isAccountImported
methods.description: Returns if an account has been imported.

methods.name: isAccountUnlocked
methods.description: Returns if the account currently is unlocked.

methods.name: isConsensusEstablished
methods.description: Returns a boolean specifying if we have established consensus with the network.

methods.name: isElectionBlockAt
methods.description: Returns a boolean expressing if the block at a given block number (height) is an election macro block.

methods.name: isMacroBlockAt
methods.description: Returns a boolean expressing if the block at a given block number (height) is a macro block.

methods.name: isMicroBlockAt
methods.description: Returns a boolean expressing if the block at a given block number (height) is a micro block.

methods.name: isValidatorElected
methods.description: Returns if our validator is currently elected.

methods.name: isValidatorSynced
methods.description: Returns if our validator is currently synced.

methods.name: listAccounts
methods.description: Returns the accounts that have been imported.

methods.name: lockAccount
methods.description: Locks the account to prevent further usage.

methods.name: mempool
methods.description: Obtains the mempool content in fee per byte buckets.

methods.name: mempoolContent
methods.description: Obtains the list of transactions that are currently in the mempool.

methods.name: pushHighPriorityTransaction
methods.description: Pushes a raw transaction with a high priority assigned into the mempool and broadcast it to the network.

methods.name: pushTransaction
methods.description: Pushes a raw transaction with a default priority assigned into the mempool and broadcast it to the network.

methods.name: removeAccount
methods.description: Removes an imported account. IMPORTANT: This action is irreversible, and the account can only be recovered with its private key.

methods.name: sendBasicTransaction
methods.description: Sends a basic transaction to the network.

methods.name: sendBasicTransactionWithData
methods.description: Sends a basic transaction, with an arbitrary data field, to the network.

methods.name: sendDeactivateValidatorTransaction
methods.description: Sends a `deactivate_validator` transaction to the network. You need to provide the address of a basic account (the sender wallet) to pay the transaction fee.

methods.name: sendDeleteValidatorTransaction
methods.description: Sends a `delete_validator` transaction to the network. The transaction fee will be paid from the validator deposit that is being returned.

methods.name: sendNewHtlcTransaction
methods.description: Sends a transaction creating a new HTLC contract to the network.

methods.name: sendNewStakerTransaction
methods.description: Sends a `new_staker` transaction to the network. You need to provide the address of a basic account (the sender wallet) to pay the transaction fee.

methods.name: sendNewValidatorTransaction
methods.description: Sends a `new_validator` transaction to the network. You need to provide the address of a basic account (the sender wallet) to pay the transaction fee and the validator deposit. Since JSON doesn't have a primitive for Option (it just has the null primitive), we can't have a double Option. So we use the following work-around for the signal data: \"\" = Set the signal data field to None. \"0x29a4b...\" = Set the signal data field to Some(0x29a4b...).

methods.name: sendNewVestingTransaction
methods.description: Sends a transaction creating a new vesting contract to the network.

methods.name: sendRawTransaction
methods.description: Sends the given serialized transaction to the network.

methods.name: sendReactivateValidatorTransaction
methods.description: Sends a `reactivate_validator` transaction to the network. You need to provide the address of a basic account (the sender wallet) to pay the transaction fee.

methods.name: sendRedeemEarlyHtlcTransaction
methods.description: Sends a transaction redeeming a HTLC contract, using the `EarlyResolve` method, to the network.

methods.name: sendRedeemRegularHtlcTransaction
methods.description: Sends a transaction redeeming a HTLC contract, using the `RegularTransfer` method, to the network.

methods.name: sendRedeemTimeoutHtlcTransaction
methods.description: Sends a transaction redeeming a HTLC contract, using the `TimeoutResolve` method, to the network.

methods.name: sendRedeemVestingTransaction
methods.description: Sends a transaction redeeming a vesting contract to the network.

methods.name: sendRemoveStakeTransaction
methods.description: Sends a `remove_stake` transaction to the network. The transaction fee will be paid from the funds being removed.

methods.name: sendRetireStakeTransaction
methods.description: Sends a `retire_stake` transaction to the network. You can pay the transaction fee from a basic account (by providing the sender wallet) or from the staker account's balance (by not providing a sender wallet).

methods.name: sendRetireValidatorTransaction
methods.description: Sends a `retire_validator` transaction to the network. You need to provide the address of a basic account (the sender wallet) to pay the transaction fee.

methods.name: sendSetActiveStakeTransaction
methods.description: Sends a `set_active_stake` transaction to the network. You can pay the transaction fee from a basic account (by providing the sender wallet) or from the staker account's balance (by not providing a sender wallet).

methods.name: sendStakeTransaction
methods.description: Sends a `stake` transaction to the network. The funds to be staked and the transaction fee will be paid from the `sender_wallet`.

methods.name: sendUpdateStakerTransaction
methods.description: Sends a `update_staker` transaction to the network. You can pay the transaction fee from a basic account (by providing the sender wallet) or from the staker account's balance (by not providing a sender wallet).

methods.name: sendUpdateValidatorTransaction
methods.description: Sends a `update_validator` transaction to the network. You need to provide the address of a basic account (the sender wallet) to pay the transaction fee. Since JSON doesn't have a primitive for Option (it just has the null primitive), we can't have a double Option. So we use the following work-around for the signal data: null = No change in the signal data field. \"\" = Change the signal data field to None. \"0x29a4b...\" = Change the signal data field to Some(0x29a4b...).

methods.name: setAutomaticReactivation
methods.description: Updates the configuration setting to automatically reactivate our validator.

methods.name: signRedeemEarlyHtlcTransaction
methods.description: Returns a serialized signature that can be used to redeem funds from a HTLC contract using the `EarlyResolve` method.

methods.name: subscribeForHeadBlock
methods.description: Subscribes to new block events (retrieves the full block).

methods.name: subscribeForHeadBlockHash
methods.description: Subscribes to new block events (only retrieves the block hash).

methods.name: subscribeForLogsByAddressesAndTypes
methods.description: Subscribes to log events related to a given list of addresses and of any of the log types provided. If addresses is empty it does not filter by address. If log_types is empty it won't filter by log types. Thus the behavior is to assume all addresses or log_types are to be provided if the corresponding vec is empty.

methods.name: subscribeForValidatorElectionByAddress
methods.description: Subscribes to pre epoch validators events.

methods.name: unlockAccount
methods.description: Unlocks the account.

methods.name: verifySignature
methods.description: Verifies the signature based on the provided public key and message.
